Description:
Detects update to a scheduled task event that contain suspicious keywords.

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Update
Query: sourcetype='windows-security' eql select * from _source_ where (eventid = '4702' and (taskcontentnew like '%\appdata\local\temp\%' or taskcontentnew like '%\appdata\roaming\%' or taskcontentnew like '%\users\public\%' or taskcontentnew like '%\windows\temp\%' or taskcontentnew like '%c:\temp\%' or taskcontentnew like '%\desktop\%' or taskcontentnew like '%\downloads\%' or taskcontentnew like '%\temporary internet%' or taskcontentnew like '%c:\programdata\%' or taskcontentnew like '%c:\perflogs\%') and (taskcontentnew like '%regsvr32%' or taskcontentnew like '%rundll32%' or taskcontentnew like '%cmd.exe</command>%' or taskcontentnew like '%cmd</command>%' or taskcontentnew like '%<arguments>/c %' or taskcontentnew like '%<arguments>/k %' or taskcontentnew like '%<arguments>/r %' or taskcontentnew like '%powershell%' or taskcontentnew like '%pwsh%' or taskcontentnew like '%mshta%' or taskcontentnew like '%wscript%' or taskcontentnew like '%cscript%' or taskcontentnew like '%certutil%' or taskcontentnew like '%bitsadmin%' or taskcontentnew like '%bash.exe%' or taskcontentnew like '%bash %' or taskcontentnew like '%scrcons%' or taskcontentnew like '%wmic %' or taskcontentnew like '%wmic.exe%' or taskcontentnew like '%forfiles%' or taskcontentnew like '%scriptrunner%' or taskcontentnew like '%hh.exe%'))
